creator_2: Pun Lun Photography Studio at High Street
physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features two children. Both of them standing up and looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. They are dressed in their ethnic costumes. The background of the photograph features a backdrop of buildings and trees.
sgcool_label_text:
This carte de visite shows a  studio photograph of two children posing with a porcelain drum stool, before a painted backdrop of a landscape with houses. This photograph was probably taken by Pun Lun photography studio at High Street in Singapore. 

Pun Lun (1864 â€“ c.1900) was a Chinese photographer, with a successful studio in Hong Kong and branches in Foochow (Fuzhou), Saigon and Singapore.

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
subject_terms_1: black-and-white photographs studio portraits double portraits children (people by age group) Peranakan folk costume
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Children Peranakan (Asian people) Ethnic costume
